picture-set.title: Saab 9-5: High Flow Intake

description.p: High flow intake installation on a 2003 Saab 9-5. Supplied by Taliaferro Saab, comes with a reusable K&N filter, adapter and mounting hardware. Replaces the restrictive stock airbox and allows you to hear turbo spool-up and bypass valve discharge sounds.
The installation takes less than an hour. The car should be placed on ramps or jack stands to provide enough room for airbox removal.

ul.li: 13 mm socket and extention: adapter bolt;
8 mm socket: headlight and inlet pipe screws;
Torx T25 socket: lower shield screws;
car ramps or jack and stands.

picture-set.picture: Start by removing the central grille piece. Slightly lift the lower part and pull the grille out.
Reach inside and press on the latch on the side grille. Lift the lower part and pull the grille out.
Here's a closer view of the side grille latch.
Undo the 10 mm screw holding the side of the headlight.
Press down on the latch on the inside of the corner light and slide the corner light forward.
Disconnect the wires and remove the corner light unit.
Undo the two remaining screws and pull out the headlight assembly. It takes some wiggling to get out.
Disconnect the wiring harness and remove the headlight.
Undo the clamp on the hose leading from the airbox to the MAF sensor.
Detach the hose from the airbox.
Remove the lower shield. It's held by half a dozen Torx T25 screws.
Release the clamp on the airbox inlet pipe. This clamp often becomes rusty, so don't hesitate to just cut it if nothing else works. You won't need it later.
Undo the 8 mm screw holding the top of the inlet pipe behind the grille.
Pull the inlet pipe out. You don't need it anymore.
Undo two 10 mm nuts holding the airbox under the fender.
Lower the airbox to the ground.
The intake kit comes with a reusable K&N filter, stainless adapter and mounting hardware.
Attach the filter to the adapter and tighten the clamp.
Remove the rubber bushing that previously held the top of the airbox.
Guide the filter assembly from below so the mounting hole matches the tab where the rubber bushing was.

Fit the hose onto the adapter. Tighten the bolt on the mounting tab and the hose clamp. Make sure you position the hose as far to the inside as possible, otherwise it will interfere with the headlight housing.
Install the headlights and the grille. Take the car for a ride and enjoy you new intake sounds ;].
